ucigame

Class GameCanvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • ucigame.GameCanvas

  • public class GameCanvas
extends java.lang.Object
    The GameCanvas class exists to provide the programmer with a single instance, the object canvas. The GameCanvas class does not have a public constructor and no additional objects of this class can be made (or would make any sense). The methods in GameCanvas are invoked on the canvas object.

    • Method Summary

      Returns the height of the canvas in pixels.

      Writes the specified number n on the canvas at location (x, y).

    • Method Detail

      • width

        public int width()
        Returns the width of the canvas in pixels.

      • height

        public int height()
        Returns the height of the canvas in pixels.

      • background

        public void background(Image image)
        Sets the canvas background to the specified Image. The background image is drawn when canvas.clear() is called inside the game's draw() method.

      • background

        public void background(int shade)
        Sets the canvas background to the specified shade. The color determined by the shade parameter is drawn when canvas.clear() is called inside the game's draw() method. The color is a shade of grey, which can range from 0 (black) to 128 (gray) to 255 (white). If shade is less than 0 or greater than 255, the method call has no effect. The default background color is white.

      • background

        public void background(int r,
              int g,
              int b)
        Sets the canvas background to the specified color. The color determined by (r, g, b) parameters is drawn when canvas.clear() is called inside the game's draw() method. See the About Color page for more information about colors in Ucigame and computer graphics.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Draws the specified background image or background color on the canvas.

      • font

        public void font(java.lang.String fontname,
        int style,
        int size)
        Sets the canvas's font to the specified fontname, style and size. An array of Strings containing the font names available on the computer is returned by Ucigame's arrayOfAvailableFonts() method. The style must be one of the following: PLAIN, BOLD, ITALIC, BOLDITALIC. The font's color will be black.

      • font

        public void font(java.lang.String fontname,
        int style,
        int size,
        int r,
        int g,
        int b)
        Sets the canvas's font to the specified fontname, style, size, and color. An array of Strings containing the font names available on the computer is returned by Ucigame's arrayOfAvailableFonts() method. The style must be one of the following: PLAIN, BOLD, ITALIC, BOLDITALIC. The font's color is determined by the r, g, and b parameters.

      • putText

        public void putText(int n,
           double x,
           double y)
        Writes the specified number n on the canvas at location (x, y). n is converted to a String which is positioned so that its upper left hand corner is x pixels to the right and y pixels down relative to the upper left hand corner of the canvas.

      • putText

        public void putText(double n,
           double x,
           double y)
        Writes the specified number n on the canvas at location (x, y). n is converted to a String which is positioned so that its upper left hand corner is x pixels to the right and y pixels down relative to the upper left hand corner of the canvas.

      • putText

        public void putText(java.lang.String string,
           double x,
           double y)
        Writes the specified String string on the canvas at location (x, y). string is positioned so that its upper left hand corner is x pixels to the right and y pixels down relative to the upper left hand corner of the canvas.
